subject: Fashion
title: Paul Poiret Freed the Corset
description: Learn Paul Poiret Freed the Corset in one minute.

hook.text: In 1906, Paul Poiret told women to take off their corsets. The fashion world gasped.

buildup.text: For 400 years, women had been laced into rigid structures. Poiret said the body should flow freely.

discovery.text: He replaced corsets with high-waisted, loose dresses inspired by Greek and Asian silhouettes.

twist.text: Poiret freed the waist but hobbled the anklesâ€”his hobble skirt was so tight women could barely walk.

climax.text: Liberation in fashion is rarely complete. One constraint often replaces another.

punchline.text: He unchained the torso and shackled the legs.

quiz.question: What was ironic about Paul Poiret's fashion revolution?
options: He freed women from corsets but introduced the restrictive hobble skirt
He only designed for men despite claiming to liberate women
His corset-free designs were more uncomfortable than corsets
